description:
Miri was a Water Nymph. She had light blue skin and white hair.  Her natural enviroment was the sea. She was also able to live on the surface and breathe air. Her voice puts men in a trance. The victims drive themselves and their ships towards her location, often to their doom. Conan assumed she was a siren. When bound with silver chains Miri was helpless and onliged to obey her captor in order to survive.

Miri was captured by Kezan Val, captain of a pirate ship. He bound her with a silver chain and then offered her a deal. If Miri succesfully drew twenty ships to crash on a rocky seacoast , allowing Val and his crew to plunder them, the pirate would release her. The twentieth ship was captained by Conan who survived the crash by swimming to the coast. There he found Miri and Kezan Val arguing. She had fullfiled her part of the deal and demanded her release. But Val had grown greedy and had no intention of releasing her.

Conan was captured and placed with other survivors of the shipwrecks. Val intented to sell them as slaves at a later point. However closed a new deal with Conan, releasing him in exchange for her own release. Conan killed Val and fullfiled his part of the bargain.
name: Miri

deck: Andrew Malvern was a character from the pre-Marvel horror comics. He was a businessman.
description:
Brief History

Malvern was a wealthy business-man whom had estranged himself from his daughter Thelma and the various people of his environment. He was only in love with Ola Montero. When Ola decided to fly back to Brazil, Malvern was invited to go with her. He decided to accept as nothing held him back. He returned home to retrieve money from his private vault. However the door shut down accidentaly and could only be opened from outside. As Ola was away and everyone else had left the house, Malvern died alone due to asphyxiation.
name: Andrew Malvern

deck: Ola Montero was a character from the pre-Marvel horror comics. She was the Brazilian lover of Andrew Malvern, a businessman.
description:
Brief History

Ola Montero was the Brazilian lover of Andrew Malvern, a businessman. Malvern otherwise had estranged himself from his daughter Thelma and the various people of their enviroment. When Ola decided to fly back to Brazil, Malvern was invited to go with her. He decided to accept as nothing held him back. He returned home to retrieve money from his private vault. However the door shut down accidentaly and could only be opened from outside. As Ola was away and everyone else had left the house, Malvern died alone due to asphyxiation.
name: Ola Montero

description: Randi Moore was a scientist formerly employed by NASA. She was then hired by businessman Harlan Silverbird to work on his vibranium projector, a device which emitted vibranium radiation. She failed to realize Silverbird was intending to use it as a weapon able to destroy satelites in orbit. She opposed his plans upon finding out but could not actually stop them. She was held in comfortable captivity in Silverbird's private island. She managed to contact Moon Knight with information on Silverbird's plan and ways to enter the island. She was almost killed as the two men fought and the island buildings turned to debris. She was transported to safety by Spector.
name: Randi Moore

deck: Priscilla was a drug dealer and addict. She was captured by Crimson Commando, Stonewall and Super Sabre.
description:
Origin

Priscilla Morrison was born to a prestigious family of Newport. At high school she became a drug dealer and never stoped when she dropped out of highschool. She formed a lucrative business, using her family name and connections to keep officials away.

Creation

Priscilla Morrison was created by Chris Claremont and Alan Davis and first appeared in The Uncanny X-Men issue 215 (1987).

Major Story Arcs

A Target

She was in time targeted by vigilantes Crimson Commando, Stonewall and Super Sabre. The trio kidnapped her and Tommy, her boyfriend, and brought them to their private estate. There they quickly disposed of Tommy while Priscilla awaited her fate.

She was soon joined by another captive, Storm. The vigilantes had misidentified Ororo as an arsonist. The trio intended to play a game, freeing the two captives and then hunting them down within the grounds of the estate. If captured the women would be killed. Priscilla and Ororo argued on what tactics to use to evade capture and on whether they could instead kill their captors.

Death

Priscilla was able to flee the estate to a nearby forest. There she stole a gun from a couple of campers, killing them to cover her tracks. She was then ambushed and knocked out by Storm. Ororo had decided to use Priscilla as bait for their captors. When Priscila regained consciousness, the drug dealer used a rock in an attempt to kill Storm. At that point Crimson Commando shot a dagger into her chest area, killing her instantly.
name: Priscilla Morrison

deck: Jane Doe is a cipher who obsessively learns her victims' personality and mannerisms, then kills them and assumes their identity by wearing their skin, eventually becoming that individual even in her own mind.
description:
Origin

While in Arkham Asylum, Waren White bribes his psychiatrist Dr. Anne Carver, into having him transferred to a minimum security prison but unbeknownst to White, Carver is actually Jane Doe. Jane had studied Dr. Carver's mannerisms before she killed the real Dr. Carver. Jane Doe had destroyed all of Dr. Carver's paperwork on her and she agrees to help White on making a transfer in a manner of speaking. As it turns out, Dr. Jeremiah Arkham is aware of Jane's activities so he instructs her to transfer White's sanity to whole new level of insanity. Arkham's vindictive motivation draws from the loss of his pension which was brought on by White's corrupt business practices at his brokerage firm. Jane captures White and locks him in Mr. Freeze’s subzero temperature cell. Jane assumes that White will die in Freeze's cell thus allowing her to claim White's identity and steal his ill begotten funds but this doesn't work out since White survives Jane's attempt to murder him. Now, White becomes the Great White Shark and Jane has a new enemy.

Major Story Arcs

House of Hush

While the courts debate on whether or not Harvey Dent is capable of standing trial, Kate Spencer aka Manhunter has a sit down with Jane Doe. Kate offers Jane a deal that if she testifies against Two-Face's insanity plea then Doe’s sentence will be reduced to life imprisonment and Kate will take the death penalty off the table. Doe tells Kate that she’ll have to think about it because the night before this meeting, an Arkham guard led Doe to Two-Face’s cell, where he has a counter offer waiting for Jane. Hush also pays Jane a visit at Arkham as Bruce Wayne. Hush influences the parole board at Arkham to release Jane Doe so that he can use her in his plan against Batman but she later escapes because she knows how Hush rewards his allies.

As it turns out, Jane Doe had killed Jeffrey Carter, Hush's impending hostage that he would use against Batman. Jane figured that if she posed as Carter then she would be captured thus allowing her to get close to Hush and steal Hush's persona as Bruce Wayne. Jane's plan was to become Bruce Wayne and take control of a multi-billion dollar industry. Unfortunately, Batman arrives and puts an end to her plan. On the bright side, Jane maimed Hush's face so severely that Hush could no longer pose as Bruce Wayne ever again or anyone for that matter.

New 52

After the events of Flashpoint, the DC Universe had a reboot. Jane Doe meets Batman for the first time when she is caught trying to steal the assets of Vivian Wenner, a rich Gotham socialite who had been dead for a week. She barely escapes discovery with the aide of Wrath. He then offers Jane a job as his inside person on the Gotham Police Department.

Jane then kidnaps Harvey Bullock and takes over his life, while forcing him to watch her actions on a television set up in his cell. She falls in love with Abigail Wilburn, the new G.C.P.D. psychologist. Jane then tries to kill Abigail and take her face but Batman stops her.

After Batman is able to subdue Jane, she is sent to Arkham Asylum where she makes plans to become Batman.

Powers & Abilities

Through constant and obsessive analysis of another individual, Jane herself becomes that person once she murders and wears their skin. Not only can she accurately copy body language and speech patterns, but can completely imitate their thought patterns and behavior.

In the New 52, Jane has gained the ability to fight like a jujitsu champion and a prize fighting boxer, whom she had killed and took over their lives.

deck: Nuclear-fueled giant, member of the Winter Guard.
description:
Origin

Illarion Pavlovich Ramskov was a Russian soldier who was genetically mutated by exposure to the faulty controls at Chernobyl-like nuclear facility. While being treated for his condition in New York, he became mentally unstable. Dubbed "Surge," he rampaged through the city before being stopped by the Avengers.

Creation

Powersurge was created by Larry Hama and Paul Ryan in 1990 and first appeared as Surge in The Avengers # 326.

Mayor Story Arcs

Winter Guard

After he was sent back to Russia, he enlisted in The Winter Guard, where he was seen battling the Mandarin. When the original Darkstar was killed in battle, Powersurge (along with several other members of the Winter Guard) took their leave.

Sometime after that, Powersurge was seen with Vanguard and Starlight in a new team dubbed The Protectorate.
